data.title: Facebook Benefits From TRP Controversy In India, As Advertisers Look For Alternative Platforms
data.text: Ongoing and developing TRP [Television Rating Points] controversy in India could be a catalyst for Facebook's advertising arm. BARC halting the entire TRP system for the next 3 months raises suspicion around the magnitude of this controversy.

data.title: Facebook Dating lands in Europe as singles look for romance under lockdown
data.text: Facebook has expanded its "Facebook Dating" service to Europe where it will compete with the likes of Tinder, Hinge, Bumble and Happn.

data.title: Facebook launches its own dating app in the UK to rival Tinder and Hinge
data.text: Facebook has launched its own dating feature to rival existing apps such as Tinder.

data.title: Top Stock Trades for Thursday: SNAP, FB, PINS, PYPL
data.text: Snap, Facebook, Pinterest and PayPal were our top stock trades for Thursday. That said, let's look at the charts to see what sticks out.

data.title: The Ratings Game: Snap roars 30% higher to record $50 billion valuation, brings Twitter and Facebook along for the ride
data.text: Snap Inc. shares jumped more than 30% in Wednesday morning trading and hit all-time highs that pushed the Snapchat parent company's valuation to more than $50 billion for the first time.

data.title: Here's Why Facebook and Other Social Media Stocks Are Soaring Today
data.text: Investors seem to be very optimistic about the entire industry.

data.title: Why You Should Buy Facebook Before The Election
data.text: Facebook's stock is following patterns common to some long-running financial market anomalies.

data.title: Facebook is working on Neighborhoods, a Nextdoor clone based on local groups
data.text: Using social networks to connect with neighbors and local services has surged during the Covid-19 pandemic, and Facebook — with 2.7 billion users globally — is now looking at how it can tap into that in a more direct way. In the same week that it was reported that Nextdoor is reportedly gearing up to […]

data.title: Facebook Takes Aim At Neighborhood-Focussed Nextdoor With New Service
data.text: Facebook Inc (NASDAQ: FB) is working on a service that would let its users connect with their neighbors in an effort to spur closer interactions among people who dwell in proximity to each other, Bloomberg reported Tuesday. What Happened: The new feature will allow the Mark Zuckerberg-led company to offer similar services to those of Nextdoor Inc, which is planning an initial public offering, according to Bloomberg.
